items.body:
> Hi 
> Thanks much for the invite but I don't think Elon is going to make it to NY 
next week. If that changes, I will let you know asap and please send his regrets 
to Jeffrey. 
> Hope all is well with you. 
> Best, 
> mb 
> • From: 
> Sent: ues ay, pri , : 
> To: Mary Beth Brown 
> Subject: Jeffrey Epstein 
> Hello Mary Beth! Jeffrey invited Elon to a dinner party he is having here in 
NY on April 23rd at his home at 7:30pm. . .Elon said it was possible he may be in 
NY and be able to attend. I am just following up to see if you might know if 
Elon can join in. 
> • Jeffrey's home address: 
> • 9 East 71st Street between 5th and Madison 
> • Please let me know! 
> • Thanks, 
> Assistant to Jeffrey Epstein 
EFTA_R1_00796901 
EFTA02141991

the jerky to eat during my time off. 
My plan is to make a batch before I leave for LSJ and some of that will then go to steve and the 
rest to you at LSJ when I arrive.

how is the island -

I am able to get a Presidential Suite and this would allow all of their meetings for 
the 8", 9" and 10" and they could also have their night meetings. 
If we were to rent furniture, which would be necessary to have the set up he is 
requesting in a meeting room, it would probably cost about the 
same. 
We can add A/V, there is wireless included in the price of the suite, food and 
beverage can be catered in the room for their breaks, etc. 
The cost is $2,200 plus 8% tax per day. 
I need an answer today in order to confirm. 
What do you think? 
Judi

Sent: Wednesday, December 22, 2010 12:56 PM 
To: 'Cecile de Jongh' 

Please call me ASAP. I don't know how I will pull that off, as the hotel does not 
have the meeting space available. 
The only thought that comes to mind is for a suite. I have them checking at the 
hotel to see if they have a suite available. If so, they might have that 
for all of their meetings. However, as of this moment, we are 
checking to see if that is even an option.

EFTA02001051
If not, I don't know how this can be pulled off. This is very last minute and his 
expectations may not be possible. Where has he been all of these 
months when we have been trying to plan this event??? 
Sorry, I'm venting 
Really need to discuss with you. 
Judi

No, the hotel could never accommodate us with a meeting space because they were booked solid 
when we did the contract so they just charged us for rooms at a discounted group rate. We were 
waiting for agenda, A/V requirements to see what kind of space we could configure. The best 
option given the fact that there will be no outside, local guests/observers (as in the past) and only 
15 people (including you) is to go with a suite. 
With warm regards, 
Cecile 
Sent from my iPhone

Space X is located about 20 miles from the Hyatt in Long Beach (Elon's =ssistant says Space Xis 10 minutes East of LAX) 
Larry has driven from =he Hyatt in Long Beach to LAX and said it was a good 45 minute drive in =o traffic, but with traffic, 
who knows how long it could take. =apquest says it should take 25 minutes from the Hyatt to Space X. 
This being said, Elon can meet for lunch on Monday Feb. 25th at 1pm at =pace X or on Wed. Feb. 27th his TED talk 
finishes up around the lunch =ime frame so he would be back at Space X around 2pm or so. His =ssistant says he could 
meet Wed. Feb. 27th in the evening.

thread.subject: Fwd: September barge log.
thread.snippet: Greetings Rich, , ann rodriquez Block picked up 9/24, 9/25, 9/26. See log details below. Forwarded message From: Bill Hague <1 a Date: Mon, Oct 1, 2018 at 5:30 PM Subject: September barge log. To: Da…
thread.body:
Greetings Rich, 
, ann rodriquez 
Block picked up 9/24, 9/25, 9/26. See log details below. 
 Forwarded message 
From: Bill Hague <1 a 
Date: Mon, Oct 1, 2018 at 5:30 PM 
Subject: September barge log. 
To: Daphne Wallace •cl 
September barge log. 
9-1 Saturday. 
To LSJ for concrete mixer. To stt port dock. 
9-4 Tuesday. 
To LSJ with Andy truck w excavator parts. To GSJ for sprayer and rocks. 
Andy truck and excavator to stt port dock. 
9-5 Wednesday. 
Plumber to LSJ. To GSJ for fiber wire and bikes. To LSJ. 
EFTA01021239
To stt. To LSJ for plumber and 450. Plumber to stt. 450 on barge overnight. 
9-6 Thursday 
450 to port dock. 
3 concrete trucks to STJ. Additional trip to STJ to get last load of concrete. Container of coral stone to LSJ 
from port dock. Truck back to stt. Sherwayne two pallets to LSJ. 
Last load concrete back to STJ at 17:30. 
Done 
9-7. Friday 
JPK truck to LSJ. Water wagon and bikes from GSJ to LSJ. 
Sherwayne with empty container to LSJ. To STT. JPK to STT. 
9-10 Monday 
JPK to LSJ 450to GSJ and tractor for rocks. Two loads topsoil. To tropical for beach cleaner. To LSJ. JPK to 
stt. 
9-11 Tuesday 
Weeks to LSJ and back. Trash man out and in. Twice. 
450 to stt. 
JPK and 450 to LSJ. 
9-12 Wednesday 
Trash truck to LSJ. Dump and Jules to GSJ trash to stt. 
JPK and trash truck to LSJ. Unload bin. Trash truck to stt. Sherwayne and container to LSJ. Fuel truck to stt. 
Sherwayne and container to GSJ. To LSJ for jpk. To GSJ for sherwayne. To stt. To LSJ with fuel truck. To stt. 
9-13 Thursday 
Two water runs from LSJ to GSJ. Dump truck run. 
9-17 Monday. 
JPK to LSJ. Twice. 08:00 and 09:00 
450 to GSJ. Water wagon to LSJ. To GSJ for lull. To Cruse bay. To Enid Pond. Get hammer. To GSJ. 
9-18 Tuesday 
Get backhoe at port Dick stt. To GSJ. To lsj. Got trailer mule to GSJ. Water wagon to LSJ then to GSJ with two 
bikes. To stt for sand. To lsj. Plant run. Back to stt with truck for Sherwayne. 
Unload and return Sit 
9-19 Wednesday. 
ABCC to LSJ. To GSJ for rocks. To LSJ. To stt for fuel. To GSJ for broken tractor, two miles. To LSJ. ABCC 
and 450. 450 to GSJ and ABCC to stt. 
9-20 Thursday. 
450 from GSJ to LSJ. 450 and water 
and a gator to GSJ 
To stt. 
9-21 Friday 
To GSJ for gator. To LSJ. Get 450 to GSJ. To LSJ for fuel truck. To S11" with some crew. 
9-24 Monday 
Fuel truck and cabinet guy to LSJ. 
weeks to LSJ. Then flat rack. Back to stt. Troy with blocks to GSJ. Back to Sit 
EFTA01021240
9-25 Tuesday 
To LSJ dumptruck 
To GSJ. 450 and lull to LSJ. SherwYne with water to LSJ and to stt. Weeks to LSJ for empty rack to stt and 
return LSJ with full each tiles. Weeks to stt. Looking fro Troy and blocks for LSJ at ramp. Troy and blocks to 
and from LSJ. 
9-26 Wednesday 
Carl protect to LSJ. 
To GSJ for 450 and water tank. Water to GSJ. To LSJ. To stt for weeks. Get old flat rack off and get new one to 
LSJ. Lull to GSJ. Weeks and protect to stt. Troy and blocks to GSJ. Back to stt. 
9-27 Thursday 
To GSJ for lull to LSJ. 
Water 459 and mule and pipe to GSJ. 450 to LSJ. 450 and gator to GSJ. To stt for Sherwayne. To LSJ. 
Sherwayne to stt. To GSJ for 450. To LSJ. To stt. 
9-28 Friday 
Weeks to LSJ. Return to stt with flat rack. To LSJ for water and insulation. To GSJ. To stt. 
EFTA01021241

items.subject: Re: IMPORTANT! Food for JE on LSJ.
items.snippet: Ok thanks Sent from my iPhone > On Nov 4, 2014, at 10:55 PM, Karyna Shuliak wrote: > Hello everyone, > Mr. Epstein has been very disappointed with the condition of the refrigerator on LSJ. He finds i…
items.body:
Ok thanks 
Sent from my iPhone 
> On Nov 4, 2014, at 10:55 PM, Karyna Shuliak wrote: 
> Hello everyone, 
> Mr. Epstein has been very disappointed with the condition of the refrigerator on LSJ. He finds it being 
disrespectful to him if we keep it in such way. He does not ask for many food items and the least we can do is to 
keep it clean and fresh for him! 
> There are a few points, that we and THE MAIDS! should keep in mind: 
> -only keep things that Mr. E and you (if you are there!) use, NOTHING EXTRA! (this is in regards to 
refrigerator items and fruits outside, not stocked items obviously) 
> -keep it in reasonable amounts, otherwise it looks cluttered and also gets spoiled 
> -keep things fresh ( this is probably the worst part: there are SO MANY items that I had to throw away because 
they were too old or spoiled! Please keep only fresh groceries! Anna, please make sure the maids check that 
things are fresh!). 
> -Note: For all foods - please buy ORGANIC when possible, if not -we can buy it in NY 
> Here is a list of items Mr.E would like to have: 
> I. Main kitchen refrigerator list: 
> - Water: Voss still 
> -Yogurts: -faje full fat 
> -BioK strawberry flavor 
> -Muffins 
> -Butterspray 
> -Organic Half&Half 
> -Lactaid whole milk (red package) 
> -Organic eggs (or our own from LSJ, but again-fresh!) 
> -Ham 
> -Muenster cheese 
> -Romaine lettuce 
> -Large tomatoes,heirloom when possible 
> -Carrots, 
> -Parsnips 
> -Dill 
> -Prune juice 
> -Beef jerky 
> -Hellmann's mayonnaise 
EFTA00574745
> -Berries: -strawberries 1 pack 
> -blueberries 2 packs 
> -Kerrygold unsalted butter 
> -Things that Anna cooked for JE, as long as they are fresh 
> Other things for main kitchen (not for the fridge): 
> -granola: homemade or good granola from NYC 
> -bananas 
> -prunes 
> -white bread 
> Ingredients to have for homemade granola: 
> -old fashioned rolled oats 
> -raw pecans 
> -raw sliced almonds 
> -organic maple syrup 
> -dark brown sugar 
> -salt 
> -extra virgin olive oil (fresh, good quality), grapeseed oil 
> -Sun-Maid raisins 
> 3. Flag pole refrigerator list: 
> - Voss still water 
> -Faje yogurt full fat 
> -Organic half&half 
> -BioK yogurt strawberry flavor 
> Other things for flag pole kitchen (not for the fridge): 
> -granola: homemade or good granola from NYC 
> -prunes 
> -Illy coffee beans 
> If you are traveling to LSJ, please send a list of additional foods you need in advance to Anna. 
> Anna, when you know that Mr. E is coming to LSJ, please check the list above to see what you have and what 
you don't, and let us know in advance what do you need us to bring from NY, or if there is anything else you 
need, that is not on the list. And Anna, PLEASE have a conversation with the maids to make sure they follow the 
instructions above! 
> I know we don't have a proper list of stocked items that we keep in the kitchen cabinets and closet, will be 
working on that. 
> Here are some visual examples of what NOT to have: 
> too many berries 

> too many cheeses, most of them are not fresh 

> 5 cans of stocks, sauces we don't use, sodas 

EFTA00574746
> No need for that many oranges and lemons 
> 4MG 6405.jpeg> 
> Remember, the items on the list may change with time, so please don't forget to update it if you are aware of 
any changes. 
> Thank you all and let me know if you have any questions or suggestions. 
> ICaryna. 
EFTA00574747

items.subject: Re: Sales Tax
items.snippet: Hi Jeffrey. I thought our call with Deloitte was quite productive. Pleas= note that, as described below, the insurance analogy is not helpful. The reason is that there is a specific rule with insuran…
items.body:
Hi Jeffrey. I thought our call with Deloitte was quite productive. Pleas= note that, as described below, 
the insurance analogy is not helpful. The reason is that there is a specific rule with insurance. The fact that there is an 
express carve-out for insurance, but not in the substituti=n scenario, suggests that we should not use the former as 
analogy to support the latter. 
Tax Regs. Sec. 526.7(a)(5) provides the following, along with two examples:=/font> 
The term "sale" does not apply to the transfer of tangible personal pro=erty to a carrier, repairman, 
warehouseman or insurer by the owner of the proper=y after payment for damages thereto or loss thereof. 
Example 1: A carrier while transporting tangible personal property for a customer, damages the 
property. The carrier then make a cash payment to the customer for the amount the customer paid for the property, 
and retains the damaged property. The retention of the property by the carrier is not a sale. 
3 
EFTA_R1_01746296 
EFTA02575102
Example 2: A motor vehicle is damaged in an accident, and the insurer consi=ers it a total loss. The 
insurer pays the owner cash, and takes the vehicle. The taking of the vehicle by the insurer is not a sale. The purchase of 
another vehicle by the owner of the damaged vehicle, with the proceeds of the insurance, is a retail sale.

thread.subject: Re: Sales Tax
thread.snippet: Hi Jeffrey. I thought our call with Deloitte was quite productive. Pleas= note that, as described below, the insurance analogy is not helpful. The reason is that there is a specific rule with insuran…
thread.body:
Hi Jeffrey. I thought our call with Deloitte was quite productive. Pleas= note that, as described below, 
the insurance analogy is not helpful. The reason is that there is a specific rule with insurance. The fact that there is an 
express carve-out for insurance, but not in the substituti=n scenario, suggests that we should not use the former as 
analogy to support the latter. 
Tax Regs. Sec. 526.7(a)(5) provides the following, along with two examples:=/font> 
The term "sale" does not apply to the transfer of tangible personal pro=erty to a carrier, repairman, 
warehouseman or insurer by the owner of the proper=y after payment for damages thereto or loss thereof. 
Example 1: A carrier while transporting tangible personal property for a customer, damages the 
property. The carrier then make a cash payment to the customer for the amount the customer paid for the property, 
and retains the damaged property. The retention of the property by the carrier is not a sale. 
3 
EFTA_R1_01746296 
EFTA02575102
Example 2: A motor vehicle is damaged in an accident, and the insurer consi=ers it a total loss. The 
insurer pays the owner cash, and takes the vehicle. The taking of the vehicle by the insurer is not a sale. The purchase of 
another vehicle by the owner of the damaged vehicle, with the proceeds of the insurance, is a retail sale.

Importance: Normal 
Thank you =I, 
I am here at 10 B now. 
Thank you for letting me know is working with JE on the upcoming events, I am sure he knows his 
expectations and preferences. 
I guess I would just like to see what JE would like me to do starting out since has the events covered.

house at 3:30 pm tomorrow to review some things. 
I greatly appreciate all of your communication. 
Best regards, 
Mark

thread.snippet: Thank you for that detailed description of the team! For now, I beleive would like to meet just those who will be involved with planning, purchasing, preparing, and serving the meals for the upcoming…
thread.body:
Thank you for that detailed description of the team! 
For now, I beleive would like to meet just those who will be involved with planning, purchasing, preparing, and 
serving the meals for the upcoming guests. 
I am certain the staff have been done these dining events before; however I would like to make certain, if JE 
wishes, to prepare, present, and serve meals on the highlest level to provide his guests with the 
best experience possible on behalf of JE whether it is informal or formal dining. 
Having said that we will need at a minimum the following: 
1. First rate Chefs who can plan and/or create the fine meals we will want. 1 Chef per 6 guests. 
2. First rate Captains to coordiante serving to guest in the dining rooms. 1 Captain per dining table. 
3. First rate Servers to serve. At a minimum 1 Server per 2 guests at table. 
4. First rate Wine Sommeliers who will be in the dining rooms as well with the Captains to attend to wine 
preparation, pouring, and any changing of wines durign meals. 
5. First rate Bartenders for any dining event involving mixed drinks to guests before, during, or after the meal. 
1 Bartender per event under 20. 
Often the Captain is also a trained Wine Sommelier, ad the Chef is a trained Bartender or vice versa. 
I would like to see all servers in formal like kind clothing whether the dining events are informal or formal. 
Captains would be suited up as well regardless of the formality and the Chef and Bartender in formal attire 
too. 
EFTA00383761
I can source any these to "rent' per event should JE want this level of service and should we need them 
beyond the staff we have. 
Best regards, 
Mark 
Mark Tollison

preparation, pouring, and any changing of wines durign meals. 
5. First rate Bartenders for any dining event involving mixed drinks to guests before, during, or after the meal. 
1 Bartender per event under 20. 
Often the Captain is also a trained Wine Sommelier, ad the Chef is a trained Bartender or vice versa. 
I would like to see all servers in formal like kind clothing whether the dining events are informal or formal.

EFTA00383669
too.

beyond the staff we have.

Mark

Thank you Lesley for that detailed description of the team! 
For now, I beleive would like to meet just those who will be involved with planning, purchasing, 
preparing, and serving the meals for the upcoming guests. 
I am certain the staff have been done these dining events before; however I would like to make 
certain, if JE wishes, to prepare, present, and serve meals on the highlest level to provide his 
guests with the best experience possible on behalf of JE whether it is informal or formal dining. 
Having said that we will need at a minimum the following: 
I. First rate Chefs who can plan and/or create the fine meals we will want. I Chef per 6 guests. 
2. First rate Captains to coordiante serving to guest in the dining rooms. I Captain per dining 
table. 
3. First rate Servers to serve. At a minimum I Server per 2 guests at table. 
4. First rate Wine Sommeliers who will be in the dining rooms as well with the Captains to attend 
to wine preparation, pouring, and any changing of wines durign meals. 
5. First rate Bartenders for any dining event involving mixed drinks to guests before, during, or 
after the meal. I Bartender per event under 20. 
Often the Captain is also a trained Wine Sommelier, ad the Chef is a trained Bartender or vice 
versa. 
I would like to see all servers in formal like kind clothing whether the dining events are informal 
or formal. 
Captains would be suited up as well regardless of the formality and the Chef and Bartender in 
formal attire too. 
I can source any these to "rent' per event should JE want this level of service and should we need 
them beyond the staff we have. 
Best regards, 
Mark

thread.body:
Lesley, 
Thank you for sharing the schedule as it completes itself. 
I am preparing to move as we speak, but please keep me updated. 
I will begin on the 16th and would like to meet all of the staff to be involved first 
thing. 
I would like to be in the loop on what current and outside staff (chefs, formally 
trained staff, etc.), settings and serving equipment (if any), and 
menus, food, and drink, etc. we will require. 
I am available at to discuss any of this should you or anyone wish to. 
Thank you and I look forward to helping make these great dining experiences for 
all involved. 
Best regards, 
Mark 
Mark Tollison

thread.body:
Thank you Leslie, 
Attached are two forms that will help plan the dinners that I am sending in advance of 
my arrival to help everyone involved. 
The first one entitled Ballet of Service is the main one we want the point person now to 
use, I can of course supervise the use of once I arrive. It is for planning all aspects 
and is completed with a fictitious example to illustrate. Please copy this one to 
another blank word doc for each dinner coming up and use one for each dinner. 
Please note we may not use all parts, but using this form will enable us to cover 
all required areas in a consistent manner. 
The second form attached Formal Dinner expenses is to keep track of expenses for each 
dinner. Again, we will want one copied to a blank word doc to use for each 
dinner. 
Best regards, 
Mark 
Mark Tollison

items.subject: Elon Musk
items.snippet: Space X is located about 20 miles from the Hyatt in Long Beach (Elon's assistant says Space X is 10 minutes East of LAX) Larry has driven from the Hyatt in Long Beach to LAX and said it was a good 45…
items.body:
Space X is located about 20 miles from the Hyatt in Long Beach (Elon's assistant says Space X 
is 10 minutes East of LAX) Larry has driven from the Hyatt in Long Beach to LAX and said it 
was a good 45 minute drive in no traffic, but with traffic, who knows how long it could take. 
Mapquest says it should take 25 minutes from the Hyatt to Space X. 
This being said, Elon can meet for lunch on Monday Feb. 25th at 1pm at Space X or on Wed. 
Feb. 27th his TED talk finishes up around the lunch time frame so he would be back at Space X 
around 2pm or so. His assistant says he could meet Wed. Feb. 27th in the evening. 
What is your preference to meet with Elon? (FYI-Elon will be in DC on Tues. Feb. 26th) 
EFTA00395166

thread.snippet: My apologies for not having jerky ready to mail on thursday sir. Truth of the matter is that I spent last thursday-sunday in the hospital then 3 days in bed. I didn't want to bother anyone with my pe…
thread.body:
My apologies for not having jerky ready to mail on thursday sir. Truth of the matter is that I spent 
last thursday-sunday in the hospital then 3 days in bed. I didn't want to bother anyone with my 
personal problems but I see now that was a bad move. I reached out to Sue and Sarah on tues 
about the when was the next day I can plan to cook for you and they were unsure. Its again my 
fault for not comunicating that I was very ill to someone. I have discharge papers and doctors 
notes if someone needs to see them. 
I am however back in full swing of things as of yesterday and can send jerky out today if you'd 
like. Also not sure about how your diet is going but if there are any requests for this coming week 
please let me know and I'll get started on them now. Stews, pies, steaks? 
Very sony about not communicating 
Francis

items.snippet: I compiled the list below for and for the trip. I would like to use it as a base that we can constantly improve on according to your needs. They are going to give me any feedback they may receive on…
items.body:
I compiled the list below for and for the trip. I would like to use it as a base that we can constantly 
improve on according to your needs. They are going to give me any feedback they may receive on the trip that 
will be useful for future travel so that we can all do our best for you. 
Je Travel Instructions 
Black Bag: 
Always make sure the black bag is packed with the items on the following list: 
Passport 
Wallet 
Drivers License 
Money 
Laptop and charger (he is currently traveling with both his laptops which have 2 separate chargers) 
He may not want to take both into the hotel so possibly a good idea to ask him before. 
iPad with charger (please make sure iPad is fully charged the night before the trip) 
Bose Headphones with spare batteries 
Swimming headphones on swim goggles. Please ensure the small white charger for the headphones is in his bag and please charge the 
headphones daily after he swims. You can charge them on your laptop 
Vitamins/Medicines. ICaryna has created little plastic bags with his daily vitamins. She has placed them in a vitamin bottle with a label 
saying `vitamin bags' 
Face Cream 
Hairbrush 
Toothbrush 
Readers, Hunters, Sunglasses 
Pens 
EFTA00943018
Always ask him if there are any additional papers he has been working on that he would like to pack 
Remember to keep the black bag in your sight all the time when moving between planes, cars, hotels etc. 
Clothing bag: 
For this particular trip his clothing bag is already packed. It is in a black Tumi Bag. 
There is a hot water bottle in the bag and a fan for the nights 
Please lay out his toiletries in the bathroom. 
Ask him if he would like his clothes laid out. 
Food Bag: 
Ask him if there is anything special he would like to take before preparing the food bag. 
Always include: 
Muffins 
Butter Spray 
Jerky 
Ginger Drink 
Mint 
Sweetener in pink packet 
Yoghurt 
Granola 
Banana 
I have also started including a small French Press, ground Illy coffee, half and half and pink sweetener just in case. 
Hotel, Navigation and Directions: 
The address of the FBO where you will be landing is the following: 
FBO: 
Atlantic Aviation Ontario. CA 
EFTA00943019
2161 East Avion Street 
Ontario, CA 91761 
The hotel you are staying at is the following: 
Hotel:

items.body:
EFTA00647147
Hi Richard, 
As per our conversation earlier this week the Digital Projections unit we speced in is no longer viable due to the 
discontinuation of the lens needed for the throw distance to the screen, the measurement from the projector to the 
screen. The remaining 2 lenses that DP have would require the projector either be moved closer or farther away which 
obviously is not an option. 
Another projector we recommend is the DLA-RS65 reference series by JVC 
) This is an extremely solid 
model and falls into the principal's price range, it's THX certified and offers over 120,000:1 native contrast ratio. Similar 
to the Sony that's currently there the video processing of the JVC is exactly how the filmmaker intended them to be 
displayed. The price of this model is $12,250 and we can get it within days. Let me know if you have any questions. 
Best 
Jeff 
Jeff 5ternhell 
Vice President 
Cutting Edge Systems 
 
EFTA00647148

thread.subject: Re: projector
thread.snippet: Digital Projections is the 1st on our list of projectors we recommend to our clients. Normal procedure is we plug the numbers into DP's calculator, price customer is willing to spend, distance from p…
thread.body:
Digital Projections is the 1st on our list of projectors we recommend to our clients. Normal procedure is we plug the 
numbers into DP's calculator, price customer is willing to spend, distance from projector to the screen and the size of the 
lift or area where the projector will live and it gives us the model that will work. If DP models don't work then we move 
EFTA00647146
down the list JVC, Sharp, Epson, NEC and so on until we find something that fits into the parameters needed. Any and all 
equipment we recommend and are dealers of have been thoroughly tested and vetted for performance and quality. Our 
clients come first and we would never recommend anything, whether it's a projector or a DVD player, that we don't 
stand behind 100%. 
The Sony model that's currently there is a 3000:1 contrast ratio with a lumens of 1600. The JVC we are recommending is 
120,000:1 contrast ratio and a lumens of 1200, this is the highest contrast ratio in the industry. It is full 1080p HD and is 
capable of up to 4x HD, the lens is a built in motorized lens that allows zoom and focus for different screen sizes and can 
achieve Cinemascope without the need of a anamorphic lens. There will be no issue with the lens as we had with the DP 
and from my conversations with Richard who told me about searching the country for the last lens available for the Sony 
a few years back. This projector is also 3D ready. 
I feel totally comfortable recommending this projector especially with it working within the confines of the price 
specified by the principal. I'm sure he will be extremely pleased with it. 
Best 
Jeff 
Jeff Sternhell 
Vice President 
Cutting Edge Systems

please advise

thread.to: Black During Dark scenes. You Will Notice Much Less Of A 'haze' During Dark Scenes And Shadow Detail won't Be Lost In
thread.subject: Re: projector
thread.snippet: The contrast ratio of a machine determines it's black level relative to the white level, so a bright projector with high lumens and low contrast ratio will have a poor black level (very grey). It wil…
thread.body:
The contrast ratio of a machine determines it's black level relative to the white level, so a bright projector with high 
lumens and low contrast ratio will have a poor black level (very grey). It will also have trouble showing shadow detail, 
and as the image goes towards black (grey), there will be color desaturation. 
EFTA00647145
Having a higher contrast ratio means the blacks will look blacker and the colors will stay more saturated as they get close 
to black during dark scenes. You will notice much less of a 'haze' during dark scenes and shadow detail won't be lost in 
the grey haze. Colors should look much better too, depending on how well calibrated the unit is once it's installed. 
That being said the MSRP on the JVC is $11999.00, I too looked on the internet and found a bunch of sellers on Ebay 
selling them for 8k which is a red flag. 9 out of 10 times theses sellers are not authorized dealers and once a unit is 
purchased from a non-authorized dealer any and all warranties are void. Furthermore a lot of these units for sale on 
Ebay are either imported from China or have been used in road shows as demo's, repackaged and sold as new. 
We've been in business for a long time, servicing and maintaining the homes of quite a few extremely high profile 
clients. We came to Mr. Epstein highly recommended and honestly I'm not happy with the tone and direction this 
relationship is going. Please let me know if the address below is where you want me to send your funds back to. 
Jeff 5ternhell 
Vice President 
Cutting Ed e S stems 
From: Richard Kahn [Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2012 2:56 PM 
To: Jeff Stern hell 
Cc: 
Subject: Re: projector 
I spoke with Mr. Epstein and he was unhappy with the 1200 lumens 
In addition i checked the price of this unit online and see that it can be purchased for approximately 58000 
which means you are marking up the model over 50% 
Can you please suggest another model with a more appropriate markup 
Thank you 
PLEASE NOTE EFFECTIVE JUNE 5TH MY CONTACT INFO WILL BE AS FOLLOWS: 
Richard Kahn 
HBRK Associates Inc. 
575 Lexington Avenue, 4th Floor, 
New York, New York 10022

Richard: 
I've attached the revised proposal for the JVC. In my professional opinion this by far is the best projector for the money, 
In reviews I've read the JVC is usually compared to the $25000 Sony VPL-VW1000ES. 
I understand that Jeff is hung up on the lumens, honestly contrast ratio is king. The brightness of a projector normally 
comes into play in a room that has a lot of ambient light, that media room is not an extremely bright room with the 
shades up so more attention should be paid to the contrast ratio. I am confident once this projector is up and Jeff gets a 
look at the image he will be extremely satisfied. 
Best 
Jeff

thread.subject: RE: projector
thread.snippet: Hi Richard, The 2 projectors that we would recommend with higher lumens are Digital Projections E Vision and Optoma TH 7500, I will go into specs below. These 2 models are geared more for commercial…
thread.body:
Hi Richard, 
The 2 projectors that we would recommend with higher lumens are Digital Projections E Vision and Optoma TH 7500, I 
will go into specs below. These 2 models are geared more for commercial applications in large rooms such as 
showrooms and corporate presentations where ambient light cannot be controlled, and that is usually the case with 
high lumens devices. These units will be fairly loud due to the fact that the fan will have to work hard to cool off the 
lamp, baffling can be installed to quiet them down a bit. I can't stress enough that lumens should not be the deciding 
factor in choosing a projector for Jeff's media room, you'll probably get a sun tan and need sunglasses while watching 
either one of these models. 
Again if Jeff wants an image that is close to 35mm film in sharpness and detail the JVC is the way to go at his price point. 
As I stated earlier the JVC is compared to the newer version of Jeff's current Sony (that is broken), the new Sony VPL-
VW1000ES is priced at about $25000. 
Digital Projections E Vision 
Lumens 8000 
Contrast ratio 2400:1 
$18891 
10/Default.aspx
Optoma TH 7500 
EFTA00647142
Lumens 6000 
Contrast ratio 2000:1 
$11000 
Jeff 5ternhell 
Vice President

thread.subject: Re: projector
thread.snippet: Digital Projections is the V on our list of projectors we recommend to our clients. Normal procedure is we plug the numbers into DP's calculator, price customer is willing to spend, distance from pro…
thread.body:
Digital Projections is the V on our list of projectors we recommend to our clients. 
Normal procedure is we plug the numbers into DP's calculator, price customer is willing 
to spend, distance from projector to the screen and the size of the lift or area where the 
projector will live and it gives us the model that will work. If OP models don't work then 
we move down the list JVC, Sharp, Epson, NEC and so on until we find something that 
EFTA_R1_00283459 
EFTA01875046
fits into the parameters needed. Any and all equipment we recommend and are dealers 
of have been thoroughly tested and vetted for performance and quality. Our clients 
come first and we would never recommend anything, whether it's a projector or a DVD 
player, that we don't stand behind 100%. 
The Sony model that's currently there is a 3000:1 contrast ratio with a lumens of 1600. 
The JVC we are recommending is 120,000:1 contrast ratio and a lumens of 1200, this is 
the highest contrast ratio in the industry. It is full 1080p HD and is capable of up to 4x 
HD, the lens is a built in motorized lens that allows zoom and focus for different screen 
sizes and can achieve Cinemascope without the need of a anamorphic lens. There will be 
no issue with the lens as we had with the DP and from my conversations with Richard 
who told me about searching the country for the last lens available for the Sony a few 
years back. This projector is also 3D ready. 
I feel totally comfortable recommending this projector especially with it working within 
the confines of the price specified by the principal. I'm sure he will be extremely pleased 
with it. 
Best 
Jeff 
Jeff Sternhell 
Vice President 
Cutting Edge Systems 
www.cuttingedge-systems.com

thread.to: Wards Black (grey), There Will Be Color desaturation.
thread.subject: Fwd: projector
thread.snippet: The contrast ratio of a machine determines it's black level relative to the white level, so a bright projector with high lumens and low contrast ratio will have a poor black level (very grey). It wil…
thread.body:
The contrast ratio of a machine determines it's black level relative to the white level, so 
a bright projector with high lumens and low contrast ratio will have a poor black level 
(very grey). It will also have trouble showing shadow detail, and as the image goes 
towards black (grey), there will be color desaturation. 
Having a higher contrast ratio means the blacks will look blacker and the colors will stay 
more saturated as they get close to black during dark scenes. You will notice much less 
of a 'haze' during dark scenes and shadow detail won't be lost in the grey haze. Colors 
should look much better too, depending on how well calibrated the unit is once it's 
installed. 
That being said the MSRP on the !VC is $11999.00, I too looked on the internet and 
found a bunch of sellers on Ebay selling them for 8k which is a red flag. 9 out of 10 times 
theses sellers are not authorized dealers and once a unit is purchased from a non-
authorized dealer any and all warranties are void. Furthermore a lot of these units for 
sale on Ebay are either imported from China or have been used in road shows as 
demo's, repackaged and sold as new. 
We've been in business for a long time, servicing and maintaining the homes of quite a 
few extremely high profile clients. We came to Mr. Epstein highly recommended and 
honestly I'm not happy with the tone and direction this relationship is going. Please let 
me know if the address below is where you want me to send your funds back to. 
EFTA_R1_00283458 
EFTA01875045
Jeff 51-ernhell 
Vice President 
Cutting Edge Systems 
www.cuttingedge-systems.com 

Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2012 2:56 PM 
To: Jeff Sternhell 
Cc: 
Subl e: prole or 
I spoke with Mr. Epstein and he was unhappy with the 1200 lumens 
In addition i checked the price of this unit online and see that it can be purchased 
for approximately $8000 
which means you are marking up the model over 50% 
Can you please suggest another model with a more appropriate markup 
Thank you 
PLEASE NOTE EFFECTIVE JUNE 5TH MY CONTACT INFO 
WILL BE AS FOLLOWS: 
Richard Kahn moo

thread.body:
Richard: 
I've attached the revised proposal for the JVC. In my professional opinion this by far is 
the best projector for the money, In reviews I've read the JVC is usually compared to the 
$25000 Sony VPL-VW1000ES. 
I understand that Jeff is hung up on the lumens, honestly contrast ratio is king. The 
brightness of a projector normally comes into play in a room that has a lot of ambient 
light, that media room is not an extremely bright room with the shades up so more 
attention should be paid to the contrast ratio. I am confident once this projector is up 
and Jeff gets a look at the image he will be extremely satisfied. 
Best 
Jeff 
Jeff 5i-ernhell

thread.subject: RE: projector
thread.snippet: Hi Richard, The 2 projectors that we would recommend with higher lumens are Digital Projections E Vision and Optoma TH 7500, I will go into specs below. These 2 models are geared more for commercial…
thread.body:
Hi Richard, 
The 2 projectors that we would recommend with higher lumens are Digital Projections E 
Vision and Optoma TH 7500, I will go into specs below. These 2 models are geared more 
for commercial applications in large rooms such as showrooms and corporate 
presentations where ambient light cannot be controlled, and that is usually the case 
with high lumens devices. These units will be fairly loud due to the fact that the fan will 
have to work hard to cool off the lamp, baffling can be installed to quiet them down a 
bit. I can't stress enough that lumens should not be the deciding factor in choosing a 
projector for Jeffs media room, you'll probably get a sun tan and need sunglasses while 
watching either one of these models. 
Again if Jeff wants an image that is close to 35mm film in sharpness and detail the JVC is 
the way to go at his price point. As I stated earlier the JVC is compared to the newer 
version of Jeff's current Sony (that is broken), the new Sony VPL-VW1000ES is priced at 
about $25000.

Lumens 8000 
Contrast ratio 2400:1

thread.body:
Sarah, 
A few things for today 
I) Attached is the first draft of the Training Manual, I think its a good place to start. This will get fine tuned as 
time goes on. One thing missing is how the phones here should be answered... If there is a standard verbiage 
you can give me, I will fill it in. 
2) I spoke to my plate rep today, Karen Harris. We will need to purchase plates soon, as you know... I can get 
catalogues for you to look at as well as set up an appointment to go look at the showroom if like. Going 
through Karen will give us a larger selection, better price and a much higher quality(stronger and lighter) than 
Crate And Barrel or other places like that. 
3) I will need to order uniforms. just like to get your approval on them before making the purchase because 
this is something i will be wearing everyday in the house and serving the guests in. Attached are pictures of the 
coats, pants, and aprons. I've always worn the blue(french laundry style) aprons because white is so difficult to 
keep white, but they do come in white if you prefer. the jackets are mostly short sleeve because we are 
approaching summer. 
4) Rich is working on accounts for Costco and butcher today 
5) We placed orders for some gear for the kitchens today. Pasta machine to make fresh pastas, dehydrator for 
dried fruits and house made jerkys, etc... 
6) I Planned on taking off this weekend and back to work on Monday. I feel like I still have a good amount of 
things to get done here in NY for JEs arrival on Saturday so I would like to spend next week training and 
cooking. A few things I am working; 
Flax Seed Granola- a few different versions that I can tweak and alter to JEs taste. Granola is something you 
can easily buy but can be wonderful if made in house... 
EFTA00543421
JE is interested in beef and turkey jerkeys- I know one company out of Brooklyn that does a great grass-fed 
product, its like high end jerky, great stuff. I plan on having that here when he arrives as well as some i will be 
making. Again we can purchase it, but to make our own is much nicer because we can make it taste however 
he would like. Smokey or sweet or even have some asian notes to it... 
Sorbets and ice creams 
Chicken and veggie stocks and sauces- the store bought broths are packed with MSG and made from who 
knows what... 
I have a bunch of new books on California cuisine and small bites • going through and working on new 
snacks 
I will touch base with the butcher on Monday and get some veal to test, hopefully i can get something worth 
cooking finally. 
7) Last but not least AUSTRALIAN WINTER TRUFFLES are coming to the country on the 27th!! We will 
need to order some as soon as thy arrive. 
Thank you 
Francis

thread.snippet: Sarah, Wanted to keep you posted on progress. Started working on the manuals and side duty sheets for the house first draft should be done by monday/tues.... These manuals will be able to carry over…
thread.body:
Sarah, 
Wanted to keep you posted on progress. 
Started working on the manuals and side duty sheets for the house first draft should be done by 
monday/tues.... These manuals will be able to carry over to all the houses with small changes for each 
house. They include- stock items to have in fridge and dry storage, daily routines such as morning muffin 
and coffee(with specifics on flatware and what to put with the place settings, as well as recipes etc..) , basic 
steps of service when guests are eating and things like this. 
I purchased a printer today to print out menus for dinners as well as menus for JE to review and check off 
things that interest him so we can continue to dial in his palate and more of what he enjoys... 
Today I am getting account with the local butcher that Steve recommends, hopefully we can finally get 
some veal that JE likes. 
EFTA00543422
• working on getting a Costco card today so we can start purchasing things in bulk. We can have up to 6 
cards per account so other people can use as well, like Lyn who does the buying and stocking for 71st. I 
also believe there is a Costco in west palm beach as well. Things like dry food items( flour, sugar, salt, 
soda, water) as well as cleaning products and paper goods we can buy in bulk here in NY and maybe even 
ship to island and save a bunch of money. Right now all the cleaning products for 71st are coming from the 
supermarket... 
We have a quote on the ice machine and I will call around to a few people today and see if they can beat 
the price. 
I still have a good amount of things to do here in NY i will keep you posted on. 
Thank you 
Francis 
Francis J. Derb 
Francis J. Derb 
Francis I. Derby 
EFTA00543423

thread.subject: Re: Checking in
thread.snippet: Attachments: Check List and Service Manual.doc; Uniforms.docx Sarah, A few things for today =div> 1) Attached is the first draft of the Training Manual, = think its a good place to start. This will g…
thread.body:
Attachments: Check List and Service Manual.doc; Uniforms.docx 
Sarah, 
A few things for today 
=div> 
1) Attached is the first draft of the Training Manual, = think its a good place to start. This will get fine tuned as time 
goes=on. One thing missing is how the phones here should be answered... If ther= is a standard verbiage you can give 
me, I will fill it in. 
2) I spoke to my plate rep today, Karen Harris. We will=need to purchase plates soon, as you know... I can get catalogues 
for you =o look at as well as set up an appointment to go look at the showroom if y=u'd like. Going through Karen will 
give us a larger selection, better =rice and a much higher quality(stronger and lighter) than Crate And Barrel=or other 
places like that. 
3) I will need to order uniforms. I'd just like to =et your approval on them before making the purchase because this is 
someth=ng i will be wearing everyday in the house and serving the guests in. Atta=hed are pictures of the coats, pants, 
and aprons. I've always worn the=blue(french laundry style) aprons because white is so difficult to keep wh=te, but they 
do come in white if you prefer. the jackets are mostly short =leeve because we are approaching summer. 
4) Rich is working on accounts for Costco and butcher t=day 
5) We placed orders for some gear for the kit=hens today. Pasta machine to make fresh pastas, dehydrator for dried 
fruit= and house made jerkys, etc... 
6) I Planned on taking off this weekend and back to wor= on Monday. I feel like I still have a good amount of things to 
get done h=re in NY for JEs arrival on Saturday so I would like to spend next week tr=ining and cooking. A few things I am 
working; 
Flax Seed Granola- a few different versions that I can =weak and alter to JEs taste. Granola is something you can easily 
buy but c=n be wonderful if made in house... 
JE is interest=d in beef and turkey jerkeys- I know one company out of Brooklyn that does=a great grass-fed product, its 
like high end jerky, great stuff. I plan on=having that here when he arrives as well as some i will be making. Again w= can 
purchase it, but to make our own is much nicer because we can make it=taste however he would like. Smokey or sweet 
or even have some asian notes=to it... 
Sorbets and ice creams 
Chicken and veggie sto=ks and sauces- the store bought broths are packed with MSG and made from w=o knows what... 
I have a bunch of new books on California cuisin= and small bites I'm going through and working on new snacks 
EFTA_R1_01193110 
EFTA02309912
I will touch base with the butcher on Monday and ge= some veal to test, hopefully i can get something worth cooking 
finally.4=iv> 
7) Last but not least=AUSTRALIAN WINTER TRUFFLES are coming to the country on the 27th!! We will=need to order 
some as soon as thy arrive. 
 
Thank you 
Francis 
On Thu, May 17, 2012 at 1:48 PM, Sarah K w=ote: 
All sounds great! Thanks for keeping me=posted!

thread.body:
wrote: 
EFTA00900579
From: Cecile de Jongh 
Date: December 22, 2010 1:36:49 PM AST 
To: JEE 
Subject: Fw: MINDSHIFT 
We are renting a suite for the meetings since space is not available, it will cost 
$2,200.00 plus 8% per day and includes wireless. I need to confirm today. 
There would have been a charge for the meeting room so I think this is the best 
solution. 
I need your approval. 
Cecile

 Forwarded Messag

Cc: Judi Nagelberg 
Sent: Tue, December 21, 2010 11:52:27 AM 

EFTA00900582
Al, 
Just let me know about AN needs and I will see what I can do about the room set up re 
being comfortable and not a conference room setting. 
You will be on the island on the 10th from about 12 noon to 3 PM. 
Meals are being arranged around the meeting schedule and Jeffrey is going with the 
following format: 
Saturday - 9 AM to 12 PM w/ one break 2:30 PM to 4:30 PM w/ one break 
Sunday - Same 
Monday - 9 AM to 11:30 AM and then go to island at 12-3PM. Free after that. 
On the evening of the arrival, we will have a small reception, if you would like with 
light bites. Snacks will be provided for the breaks and your guests will join you for all 
meals. 
There are things to do for the spouses like the beach, shopping in town, island tours 
etc... 
I hope this helps! 
Cecile 
EFTA00900583
DISCLAIMER: The information contained in this e-mail may be privileged,confidential, and protected from disclosure. If 
you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or duplication of this 
communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender 
immediately and delete all copies. 
From: Al seckel 

Sent: Tue, December 21, 2010 1:15:55 PM 

Hi Cecile, 
So, off the top of my head, and with no approval from Jeff...here are 
some of my thoughts. 
In basic, we would need a very casual setting, of comfortable chairs 
and sofas, rather than a conference type sterile environment, where 
people can just relax around a basic circle and discuss and argue 
various ideas. I do believe that a white board and projector for mac 
and pc are needed. basic drinks, snacks... 
I have no information on how people will arrive, what is happening 
to the spouses/partners. Can't just "dump them," so some things 
would be nice to be set up. What sort of other relaxing activities will 
be there. What happens when people arrive, that night, etc. 
We wanted to arrange for one of the people to do a gourmet bbq and 
talk about the science of cooking on one of the nights at Jeff's 
island... (but that would have to be arranged) 
EFTA00900584
need to know about meals (both for the attendees as well as their 
guests). When they can join and when they can not. 
If you want to call to discuss, I would be happy to arrange a time. 
Perhaps, we can work somethings out on the above, and then, Jeff 
doesn't have to think about it? 
Appreciative of your understanding in the above. 
Yours, 
Al 
From: Cecile de Jongh ‹ > 
To: Al Seckel e.[ > 
Sent: Tue, December 21, 2010 9:58:06 AM 
Subject: Fw: MINDSHIFT 
Al, 
If you have no preference on room set up, do you want me to just arrange that? Do you 
have AV needs? Please see below. 
Cecile

Me again, 
Just spoke with hotel and they can accommodate us on the 8th and 9th, but have no meeting space at 
all on the 10th. 
Is it possible that they can go to Mr. Epstein's on the 10th for their meeting and outing with spouses? 
Also, need other info requested; a/v, mom set up, etc. 
Please get back to me ASAP. 
Sorry, I know this is a bad time for you, but need to be able to run with this. 
Thanks! 
Warm regards, 
Judi

thread.body:
No, the hotel could never accommodate us with a meeting space because they were booked solid when we 
did the contract so they just charged us for rooms at a discounted group rate. We were waiting for agenda, 
A/V requirements to see what kind of space we could configure. The best option given the fact that there 
will be no outside, local guests/observers (as in the past) and only 15 people (including you) is to go with a 
suite. 
With warm regards, 
Cecile 
Sent from my iPhone

If not, I don't know how this can be pulled off. This is very last minute and his expectations may not be

thread.subject: ARBITRAGE
thread.snippet: http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118026780.html?categoryid=13=1 VARIETY Posted: Tue., Nov. 2, 2010, 6:08pm Al Pacino heads for 'Arbitrage' Financial thriller also stars Susan Sarandon, Eva Green By…
thread.body:
http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118026780.html?categoryid=13=1 
VARIETY 
Posted: Tue., Nov. 2, 2010, 6:08pm 
Al Pacino heads for 'Arbitrage' 
Financial thriller also stars Susan Sarandon, Eva Green 
By PAMELA MCCLINTOCK 
Al Pacino has financial thriller "Arbitrage" set as his next film. He'll star opposite Eva Green and Susan Sarandon. 
Writer-director Nicholas Jarecki is set to start principal photography in Gotham next spring. 
Michael Ohoven ("Capote") is producing and financing through his Infinity Media banner. Kevin Turen and Robert Salerno also are 
producers. 
Lisa Wilson's Parlay Films, an affiliate of GK Films, is selling international rights and will debut the project at the American Film 
Market. ICM is repping North American rights. 
Laura Bickford ("Traffic") and Brian Young ("The Runaways") are exec producing the pic. 
"Arbitrage" stars Pacino as a hedge fund magnate who is in over his head and desperate to complete the sale of his trading empire 
to a major bank before his fraud is revealed. But an unexpected, bloody error forces him to turn to the most unlikely corner for 
help. 
Foreign buyers have shown keen interest in financial dramas in the wake of the economic collapse of late 2008. Myriad Pictures has 
seen brisk sales for Kevin Spacey-Jeremy Irons-Zachary Quinto topliner "Margin Call," which will also be at AFM. 
Other upcoming Pacino projects include Sony's Adam Sandler comedy "Jack and Jill," which is eyeing a November start date. He's 
also circling a "King Lear" project. He was last in theaters in 2008 in "Righteous Kill." 
Sarandon was most recently seen in 20th Century Fox's "Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps." 
Green ("Casino Royale," "The Golden Compass") is in production on the "Camelot" series for Starz and GK-TV. 
EFTA00752152
Jarecki's credits include docu "The Outsider" featuring James Toback. He also co-wrote "The Informers" with Bret Easton Ellis. He's 
the brother of filmmakers Andrew and Eugene Jarecki. 
Ohoven is in post-production on "The Fields," starring Sam Worthington. 
Infinity will next produce and finance psychological thriller "The Door," which begins lensing later this month. 
Contact Pamela McClintock ai 
Nicholas Jarecki 
The Green Room 
--- End of Forwarded Message

thread.subject: Fwd: FW: "Ar itrage
thread.snippet: Jeffery, Do you want my feedback? The reason Michael Ohoven is wanting Louisiana is most likely because the rebate there is far better than New York, crew rates are less, unions are easier to make de…
thread.body:
Jeffery, 
Do you want my feedback? The reason Michael Ohoven is wanting Louisiana is most likely because the rebate there is far 
better than New York, crew rates are less, unions are easier to make deals on the side with, and he may have fund with other 
financiers to do a certain number of films at a certain price. 
He's giving Nick the bare minimum I assume that he believes is required for New York exteriors (3 days). 
Obviously I've not read the screenplay, but that cast makes it a long shot. If the script is remarkable, and his execution is 
great, the upside is that it does well at festival circuit and sells for a top price. 
Obviously I know your longstanding important relationship with The Jarecki's , so let me know how I can be helpful to you. 
Best, 
Barry 
From: Jeff Epstein <jeevacation@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, 25 Nov 2010 05:56:50 -0800 
To: Barry Josephson 
Subject: Fwd: FW: "Ar itrage 
Forwarded message
From: Nicholas Jarecki 
Date: Thu, Nov 25, 2010 at 12:56 AM 
Subject: FW: "Arbitrage" 
To: Jeffrey Epstein 
CONFIDENTIAL 
Hi Jeffrey, 
Thanks for your call today; I hope I was amusing even under my current circumstances! 
EFTA00752150
Per our talk, enclosed please find a finance plan for Arbitrage, as well as my updated sales figures (now up to 4.4 million sold.) I 
have also included the plan as an excel file so you can tweak it to your liking;) The numbers aren't perfect but they are within 
striking distance and I've done a lot of work to vet them and get them here, considering every possible cost and revenue source. 
Unfortunately, as I mentioned my current equity investor (Michael Ohoven) announced to me yesterday that he will not take any 
partners and will only shoot the film for 10MM all-in (including finance) in Louisiana with 26 shooting days, 3 of them in New York, 
with me not having much say on anything. He is asking me to sign over all rights now. He has some special deal in Lousiana that I 
don't even want to know about and I think that's his big motivation. 
Of course, I have no idea whether Al or the rest of the cast would go to Lousiana and if Lisa Wilson my sales agent would be able to 
preserve her sales figures if we shot there. I feel creatively the film should be shot in NYC, especially as I have all my free toys there I 
can provide to enhance its feeling. 
I'm open to any arrangement that works for you. I have the passion to see this movie through and make it with heart and beauty in 
New York, in the incredible locations I can provide for free, with the great cast that has come to play. Lost week the hip-hop 
sensation "Drake" signed on to playJimmy! He's a wonderful guy and will do great work (and work hard to promote the movie and 
substantially raise our American media and viewing profile.) 
Kevin Turen (my creative producer and partner from the film's genesis) and I have committed to put up 500k in equity each. He and 
I have also deferred all of our producing fees, and I have deferred my writing and directing fee entirely. 
In the last week I have faced the inevitable; I have begun cutting the script with my teacher, and we have artfully rewritten pages 
(we're not there yet, but we'll get to 105 pages) and the budget down to an achievable 9.5MM for a 29 day shoot in NYC that would 
start March 21st. 
The attached plan assumes we can get a bank loan after fees and discounts of about 6MM. I don't have term sheets, but I have 
kicked the tires on these numbers pretty well and believe they will hold up. I'm trying to get term sheets now (but with holidays it is 
tough this week). My excellent line producer Bob Salerno ("A Single Man," "21 Grams") is already in process with a company called 
TCF on tax credit finance bids for New York. 
We will need about 3.8MM in equity to finance the remainder of the film. As Kevin and I will put up 1MM together, we need an 
additional 2.8MM in equity. 
I believe we will recoup and go into profit based on this plan, as it only assumes a 1.1MM US sale and there are about 2.8MM 
worth of unloaned foreign sales and tax credits to collect upon, assuming no overages in foreign sales. You asked how we could 
make money: we could get it by doing better on foreign sales (as they will certainly increase from showing and selling completed 
footage to buyers if I deliver a quality film— right now they have only bought a piece of paper- so when I show footage if it is good 
they will pay more— of course you have to believe I will make a good movie!) We could also make money through a higher US sale. 
Sales recently have been as high as 5mm and some decent films (like Rabbit Hole with Nicole Kidman) have gone for 3mm- we're 
only projecting 1.1mm. Finally one could force it straight to DVD, and I believe with this cast collect at least 2mm just from that, and 
already be 1mm in profit. I believe the downside risk of the equity is 1mm (we'd have to really mess up to have 0 domestic sale or 
drastically reduced remaining foreign)- and the upside is probably 2mm at least (lm increase on foreign, and lm increase on 
domestic). Another way to go would be to self-distribute domestically, and put up our own P&A (although this is tricky and will 
require a couple million more spend- but could result in 5mm upside— and it's a decision that can be made down the line). 
If you thought any of this plan made sense, we would be ready to go, and the moves would be: to sign off (we can execute contracts 
very quickly), fund some prep (200k of work to start scouting and working on the movie in mid-December in NYC), and make Al pay 
or play for our March 21st shoot (his agent Jeff Berg is screaming for his 1.8mm money guarnatee now!) in order to keep our dates 
and our principal actor. 
We would shoot March 21 in NYC for about 30 days over 6 weeks. We'd then edit and post the film in New York over a 3 month 
period. We'd probably be ready to deliver it around March 2012. 
One additional option would be also take out the bank position, which would save at least 714k in fees and a lot of headache. But it 
requires a lot more commitment (an additional 6mm)- so we can table that and know it will work without it. 
If you came in you could executive produce or produce the film, and come on set, go to all premieres, receive awards, all the nice 
fun stuff. 
Finally our foreign sales agent Lisa is currently at deal 7.5% upfront fees of her sales (7.5% deferred) plus 150k market fee in these 
projections. I believe if we were serious we could ask her to defer a bit more, but who knows. 
EFTA00752151
I thank you very much for looking at all this. As my current partner has put a gun to my head, I do need to give him a yes by next 
Tuesday, or risk no movie at all. Of course, I'd love to tell him goodbye. 
Have a great Thanksgiving, and no matter the answer- I appreciate you looking at this all. I expect nothing. 
Give my dad a hug for me. 
Best, 
Nick 
PS please note attached budget is 10.65mm- but we have down to 9.5-10mm- still working with my guy to redo the numbers but 
they are really there- just don't have document finished yet- and numbers are real. 
PPS This may be in "movie shorthand" so I can walk through in detail anything that doesn't just make sense. I also have all the real 
people to talk to available at a moment's notice.

don't even want to know about and I think that's his big motivation. 
EFTA00776681
Of course, I have no idea whether Al or the rest of the cast would go to Lousiana and if Lisa Wilson my sales agent would be able to 
preserve her sales figures if we shot there. I feel creatively the film should be shot in NYC, especially as I have all my free toys there I 
can provide to enhance its feeling. 
I'm open to any arrangement that works for you. I have the passion to see this movie through and make it with heart and beauty in 
New York, in the incredible locations I can provide for free, with the great cast that has come to play. Lost week the hip-hop 
sensation "Drake" signed on to play Jimmy! He's a wonderful guy and will do great work (and work hard to promote the movie and 
substantially raise our American media and viewing profile.) 
Kevin Turen (my creative producer and partner from the film's genesis) and I have committed to put up 500k in equity each. He and 
I have also deferred all of our producing fees, and I have deferred my writing and directing fee entirely. 
In the last week I have faced the inevitable; I have begun cutting the script with my teacher, and we have artfully rewritten pages 
(we're not there yet, but we'll get to 105 pages) and the budget down to an achievable 9.5MM for a 29 day shoot in NYC that would 
start March 21st. 
The attached plan assumes we can get a bank loan after fees and discounts of about 6MM. I don't have term sheets, but I have 
kicked the tires on these numbers pretty well and believe they will hold up. I'm trying to get term sheets now (but with holidays it is 
tough this week). My excellent line producer Bob Salerno ("A Single Man," "21 Grams") is already in process with a company called 
TCF on tax credit finance bids for New York. 
We will need about 3.8MM in equity to finance the remainder of the film. As Kevin and I will put up 1MM together, we need an 
additional 2.8MM in equity. 
I believe we will recoup and go into profit based on this plan, as it only assumes a 1.1MM US sale and there are about 2.8MM 
worth of unloaned foreign sales and tax credits to collect upon, assuming no overages in foreign sales. You asked how we could 
make money: we could get it by doing better on foreign sales (as they will certainly increase from showing and selling completed 
footage to buyers if I deliver a quality film— right now they have only bought a piece of paper- so when I show footage if it is good 
they will pay more— of course you have to believe I will make a good movie!) We could also make money through a higher US sale. 
Sales recently have been as high as 5mm and some decent films (like Rabbit Hole with Nicole Kidman) have gone for 3mm- we're 
only projecting 1.1mm. Finally one could force it straight to DVD, and I believe with this cast collect at least 2mm just from that, and 
already be 1mm in profit. I believe the downside risk of the equity is 1mm (we'd have to really mess up to have 0 domestic sale or 
drastically reduced remaining foreign)- and the upside is probably 2mm at least (lm increase on foreign, and lm increase on 
domestic). Another way to go would be to self-distribute domestically, and put up our own P&A (although this is tricky and will 
require a couple million more spend- but could result in 5mm upside— and it's a decision that can be made down the line). 
If you thought any of this plan made sense, we would be ready to go, and the moves would be: to sign off (we can execute contracts 
very quickly), fund some prep (200k of work to start scouting and working on the movie in mid-December in NYC), and make Al pay 
or play for our March 21st shoot (his agent Jeff Berg is screaming for his 1.8mm money guarnatee now!) in order to keep our dates 
and our principal actor. 
We would shoot March 21 in NYC for about 30 days over 6 weeks. We'd then edit and post the film in New York over a 3 month 
period. We'd probably be ready to deliver it around March 2012. 
One additional option would be also take out the bank position, which would save at least 714k in fees and a lot of headache. But it 
requires a lot more commitment (an additional 6mm)- so we can table that and know it will work without it. 
If you came in you could executive produce or produce the film, and come on set, go to all premieres, receive awards, all the nice 
fun stuff. 
Finally our foreign sales agent Lisa is currently at deal 7.5% upfront fees of her sales (7.5% deferred) plus 150k market fee in these 
projections. I believe if we were serious we could ask her to defer a bit more, but who knows. 
I thank you very much for looking at all this. As my current partner has put a gun to my head, I do need to give him a yes by next 
Tuesday, or risk no movie at all. Of course, I'd love to tell him goodbye. 
Have a great Thanksgiving, and no matter the answer- I appreciate you looking at this all. I expect nothing. 
Give my dad a hug for me. 
Best, 
EFTA00776682
Nick 
PS please note attached budget is 10.65mm- but we have down to 9.5-10mm- still working with my guy to redo the numbers but 
they are really there- just don't have document finished yet- and numbers are real. 
PPS This may be in "movie shorthand" so I can walk through in detail anything that doesn't just make sense. I also have all the real 
people to talk to available at a moment's notice.

there is far better than New York, crew rates are less, unions are easier to make deals on the side with, and he 
may have fund with other financiers to do a certain number of films at a certain price. 
He's giving Nick the bare minimum I assume that he believes is required for New York exteriors (3 days). 
Obviously I've not read the screenplay, but that cast makes it a long shot. If the script is remarkable, and his 
execution is great, the upside is that it does well at festival circuit and sells for a top price. 
Obviously I know your longstanding important relationship with The Jarecki's , so let me know how I can be 
helpful to you. 
Best, 
Barry J

thread.subject: ARBITRAGE
thread.snippet: http://www.variety.com/articleNR1118026780.html?categoryid=13=1 VARIETY Posted: Tue., Nov. 2, 2010, 6:08pm Al Pacino heads for 'Arbitrage' Financial thriller also stars Susan Sarandon, Eva Green By P…
thread.body:
http://www.variety.com/articleNR1118026780.html?categoryid=13=1 
VARIETY 
Posted: Tue., Nov. 2, 2010, 6:08pm 
Al Pacino heads for 'Arbitrage' 
Financial thriller also stars Susan Sarandon, Eva Green 
By PAMELA MCCLINTOCK 
Al Pacino has financial thriller "Arbitrage" set as his next film. He'll star opposite Eva Green and Susan Sarandon. 
Writer-director Nicholas Jarecki is set to start principal photography in Gotham next spring. 
Michael Ohoven ("Capote") is producing and financing through his Infinity Media banner. Kevin Turen and Robert Salerno also are 
producers. 
Lisa Wilson's Parlay Films, an affiliate of GK Films, is selling international rights and will debut the project at the American Film Market. 
ICM is repping North American rights. 
Laura Bickford ("Traffic") and Brian Young ("The Runaways") are exec producing the pic. 
"Arbitrage" stars Pacino as a hedge fund magnate who is in over his head and desperate to complete the sale of his trading empire to 
a major bank before his fraud is revealed. But an unexpected, bloody error forces him to turn to the most unlikely corner for help. 
Foreign buyers have shown keen interest in financial dramas in the wake of the economic collapse of late 2008. Myriad Pictures has 
seen brisk sales for Kevin Spacey-Jeremy Irons-Zachary Quinto topliner "Margin Call," which will also be at AFM. 
Other upcoming Pacino projects include Sony's Adam Sandler comedy "Jack and Jill," which is eyeing a November start date. He's also 
circling a "King Lear" project. He was last in theaters in 2008 in "Righteous Kill." 
Sarandon was most recently seen in 20th Century Fox's "Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps." 
Green ("Casino Royale," "The Golden Compass") is in production on the "Camelot" series for Starz and GK-TV. 
Jarecki's credits include docu "The Outsider" featuring James Toback. He also co-wrote "The Informers" with Bret Easton Ellis. He's the 
brother of filmmakers Andrew and Eugene Jarecki. 
Ohoven is in post-production on "The Fields," starring Sam Worthington. 
Infinity will next produce and finance psychological thriller "The Door," which begins lensing later this month. 
Contact Pamela McClintock at 
EFTA00752156
Nicholas Jarecki 
The Green Room 
End of Forwarded Message

items.body:
We had to come with a clever way of repeating your name endlessly on a page with unique 
content to drive it to the top of the search engine. So, in a total stream of consciousness, I 
constructed the following interview between us together of 9500 words! I apologize if I put words 
into your mouth, but there is a disclaimer at the end. it is all for a purpose, and to make your 
science site real... perhaps, you might even find it an slightly interesting read... 
This will be going up today on the site with other stuff.

thread.to: morrow? Early Next week? Seriously ... We Know What We Are doing.
thread.subject: Re: I hope you enjoy this
thread.snippet: Jeff, Terrific idea. I am all for it! However, can you provide me with 10,000 word real interviews with all these scientists with that much content, questions (real or not) in the time you wanted? To…
thread.body:
Jeff, 
Terrific idea. I am all for it! However, can you provide me with 10,000 word real interviews with all 
these scientists with that much content, questions (real or not) in the time you wanted? Today, 
tomorrow? Early next week? Seriously ... we know what we are doing. 
There is a TREMENDOUS time crunch here to get this out fast as possible. so you can get results 
as quickly as possible. In time, of course, it will be constructed with other scientists too, both ones 
you know and ones that you don't know, and should, and in your own voice. 
The purpose of this is for the search engines, which means, I made it deliberately long, I broke up 
your questions repeatedly, and repeated your name over and over in a way that wasn't obvious for 
what we were trying to accomplish. The fastest first path is the one we are taking. I used my 
interview first, because I could control it, and I could write it easily, and it had real content, not 
pseudo-content, and get it up by today. 
Just fyi, it took me several hours to get Murray to give me only two sentences that I could use. 
Other interviews will be going up, but they are in process of being made. I have asked for 
materials from your side, but I can't use just names and generalities if you want this to be effective. 
Ok, so, I know most of the people and their work that you are referring to, but I have to build the 
content for them, and as these are serious people, it needs to be done correctly. Otherwise, it 
looks bad on them and bad on you, and we don't want any more of that. 
I am happy to correct any of your questions to put them in "your voice" if you want to take the time 
to make such edits. In the meantime, let us get this up there, and when you have the time and 
inclination, we can happily change it. None of this needs to be etched in stone, other than for the 
express purpose of achieving your goal. 
If you have any existing interviews with anyone that are transcribed or otherwise, I sure would 
need it asap. 
I have my teams actually pulling all nighters. I haven't slept for 48 hours working non-stop on this. 
So, please Jeff, we are all pulling for you very hard. Myself especially... I don't make a single 
penny on this. 
I know that all of this is frustrating and horribly invasive. I know that you are private. We have to 
work with the constraints of the system, and we have already gotten discernable results. 
I will write more later. 
Best, 
me 
From: Jeffrey E stein 
To: Al seckel < 
EFTA00754422
Sent: Sat, October 16, 2010 8:37:09 PM 
Subject: Re: I hope you enjoy this 
why don't we construct more with other scientists. with real questions and my real voice.

thread.to: Get Other Jeffrey Epstein Photos To Appear In Google Search Results
thread.subject: Re: I hope you enjoy this
thread.snippet: Thank you Jeffrey, I didn't mean to be testy in the last email, but we are quite exhausted because this job is so incredibly massive and intensive, and we are under a lot of pressure to give you the…
thread.body:
Thank you Jeffrey, I didn't mean to be testy in the last email, but we are quite exhausted because 
this job is so incredibly massive and intensive, and we are under a lot of pressure to give you the 
results you would want. 
FYI, here is an email I just received from my other team leader, who is the leading expert in this 
area...: It will give you a good overview of how much is involved. 
Al, 
We need to flesh out the science and sports blogs this week. You give me the remaining stuff for 
science, I'll generate content for sports. We also need asap at least two articles (400+ words) 
on Jeffrey Epstein and Science from you. (I'll take care of the sports) Philippines are continuing to 
do a lot of backend work, with additional work as soon as they receive the articles and photos from 
Jeff. The sooner this happens, the more likely we have a shot of getting ranked by end of the 
month. This activity will be ongoing through the end of the month. Sports blog will continue after 
that. Science blog should also continue after that as well. 
Once additional money comes in I can continue to start pimping the "other" Jeffrey Epsteins that 
already exist on the web, trying to jump them up in rankings. We will also be working simultaneously 
to get other Jeffrey Epstein photos to appear in Google Search results 
We are also working on the JeffreyEpstein.org which will be the charity site. I need similar extensive 
and specific content on his charitable work. Also, we will do a mobile version of the science site so 
that we can dominate mobile searches. 
Then i will 
build jeffreyepsteinforbes.com jeffreyepsteinvanityfair.com jeffreyepsteindeposition.com jeffreyepste 
indailybeast.com sites which will give a positive spin on these news articles (NOTE: These are 
search terms that come up via google instant or google suggest so they must be addressed) 
We are continuing trying to tweak the Wikipedia process. He has over twenty people with google 
alerts on him, who go and undo our edits every time we remove material. We will have to take some 
more extreme measures, but this will be easier with links once the other sites are up and functional. 
We also need tol create another Jeffrey Epstein site (with videos) which should help alleviate some 
of the video search results.

thread.body:
That will be much appreciated! I really need the following from you, and again, apologize that this will 
take up your personal time, but need to get some of this in your own voice, which obviously I can't or 
others write. Can you just get a tape recorder and just rabbit on your thoughts on the following areas. 
What you say needs to be interesting and specific to each topic. Think of them as chapters, or in this 
case blogs. We can then get these transcribed and edit them and post them. this will be an enormous 
and necessary help! Go on for at least ten to 15 minutes for each. 
Here are the following science categories (don't mix up topics in speaking, keep them specific to 
each category): 
Fundamental and Theoretical Physics 
Applied Physics 
Theoretical Mathematics 
Applied Mathematics 
Evolutionary Biology 
Quantum Computing 
Artificial Intelligence 
Cognitive Neuroscience 
Language 
Perception 
Complexity 
Education 
Thinking Skills, Creativity, and Innovation 
Astronomy

thread.body:
We had to come with a clever way of repeating your name endlessly on a page with unique 
content to drive it to the top of the search engine. So, in a total stream of consciousness, I 
constructed the following interview between us together of 9500 words! I apologize if I put words 
into your mouth, but there is a disclaimer at the end. it is all for a purpose, and to make your 
science site real... perhaps, you might even find it an slightly interesting read... 
This will be going up today on the site with other stuff.
